author: Bob Marley
quote_text: “Only once in your life, I truly believe, you find someone who can completely turn your world around. You tell them things that you’ve never shared with another soul and they absorb everything you say and actually want to hear more. You share hopes for the future, dreams that will never come true, goals that were never achieved and the many disappointments life has thrown at you. When something wonderful happens, you can’t wait to tell them about it, knowing they will share in your excitement. They are not embarrassed to cry with you when you are hurting or laugh with you when you make a fool of yourself. Never do they hurt your feelings or make you feel like you are not good enough, but rather they build you up and show you the things about yourself that make you special and even beautiful. There is never any pressure, jealousy or competition but only a quiet calmness when they are around. You can be yourself and not worry about what they will think of you because they love you for who you are. The things that seem insignificant to most people such as a note, song or walk become invaluable treasures kept safe in your heart to cherish forever. Memories of your childhood come back and are so clear and vivid it’s like being young again. Colours seem brighter and more brilliant. Laughter seems part of daily life where before it was infrequent or didn’t exist at all. A phone call or two during the day helps to get you through a long day’s work and always brings a smile to your face. In their presence, there’s no need for continuous conversation, but you find you’re quite content in just having them nearby. Things that never interested you before become fascinating because you know they are important to this person who is so special to you. You think of this person on every occasion and in everything you do. Simple things bring them to mind like a pale blue sky, gentle wind or even a storm cloud on the horizon. You open your heart knowing that there’s a chance it may be broken one day and in opening your heart, you experience a love and joy that you never dreamed possible. You find that being vulnerable is the only way to allow your heart to feel true pleasure that’s so real it scares you. You find strength in knowing you have a true friend and possibly a soul mate who will remain loyal to the end. Life seems completely different, exciting and worthwhile. Your only hope and security is in knowing that they are a part of your life.”

Also remember, sisters make the best friends in the world. As for lovers, well, they'll come and go too. She's not perfect—you aren't either, and the two of you may never be perfect together but if she can make you laugh, cause you to think twice, and admit to being human and making mistakes, hold onto her and give her the most you can. She may not be thinking about you every second of the day, but she will give you a part of her that she knows you can break—her heart. So don't hurt her, don't change her, don't analyze and don't expect more than she can give. Smile when she makes you happy, let her know when she makes you mad, and miss her when she's not there.”

He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.”

author: Ernest Hemingway,

author: Roy T. Bennett,

author: Audrey Hepburn

author: Charles M. Schulz

author: Jonathan Safran Foer

author: Roy T. Bennett

author: Dale Carnegie,

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.”

author: George Burns

author: Marcel Proust

author: Roy T. Bennett,

author: Chuck Palahniuk,

author: Bill Keane
quote_text: “Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present.”

author: Shel Silverstein
quote_text: “Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be.”

author: John Lennon
quote_text: “You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one.”

author: Paulo Coelho,
quote_text: “When we love, we always strive to become better than we are. When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.”

author: Langston Hughes
quote_text: “Hold fast to dreams,

author: Stephenie Meyer,

author: Anne Frank,

author: Robert Fulghum,
quote_text: “I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.”

author: Emily Dickinson
quote_text: “Hope is the thing with feathers

author: Chad Sugg,
quote_text: “If you're reading this...

author: Alexandre Dumas
quote_text: “There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life.

author: Tom Bodett
quote_text: “They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

author: Paulo Coelho,

author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote_text: “Hope

author: Barbara Kingsolver,

author: Roy T. Bennett,

author: José N. Harris,

author: Markus Zusak,
quote_text: “Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.”

author: J. D. Salinger,
quote_text: “Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.”

author: John Guare,
quote_text: “It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
quote_text: “I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.”

author: Maxine Hong Kingston

author: C.S. Lewis

author: J.M. Barrie,

author: John Lennon
quote_text: “I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

author: Jon Katz
quote_text: “I think if I've learned anything about friendship, it's to hang in, stay connected, fight for them, and let them fight for you. Don't walk away, don't be distracted, don't be too busy or tired, don't take them for granted. Friends are part of the glue that holds life and faith together. Powerful stuff.”

author: Edgar Allan Poe,
quote_text: “I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it.”

author: Greg Behrendt
quote_text: “If he’s not calling you, it’s because you are not on his mind. If he creates expectations for you, and then doesn’t follow through on little things, he will do same for big things. Be aware of this and realize that he’s okay with disappointing you. Don’t be with someone who doesn’t do what they say they’re going to do. If he’s choosing not to make a simple effort that would put you at ease and bring harmony to a recurring fight, then he doesn’t respect your feelings and needs. “Busy” is another word for “asshole.” “Asshole” is another word for the guy you’re dating. You deserve a fcking phone call.”

author: Anonymous,
quote_text: “And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.”

author: Hafiz
quote_text: “And still, after all this time,

author: Corrie ten Boom

author: C.S. Lewis,
quote_text: “I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
quote_text: “I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.”

author: Rainer Maria Rilke,
quote_text: “Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote_text: “All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.”

author: Paulo Coelho
quote_text: “None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.”

author: Sylvia Plath
quote_text: “I talk to God but the sky is empty.”

author: Greg Behrendt
quote_text: “I'm about to make a wild, extreme and severe relationship rule: the word busy is a load of crap and is most often used by assholes. The word "busy" is the relationship Weapon of Mass Destruction. It seems like a good excuse, but in fact in every silo you uncover, all you're going to find is a man who didn't care enough to call. Remember men are never to busy to get what they want.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.”

author: Pablo
quote_text: “No matter how old you are now. You are never too young or too old for success or going after what you want. Here’s a short list of people who accomplished great things at different ages

author: C. JoyBell C.
quote_text: “A star falls from the sky and into your hands. Then it seeps through your veins and swims inside your blood and becomes every part of you. And then you have to put it back into the sky. And it's the most painful thing you'll ever have to do and that you've ever done. But what's yours is yours. Whether it’s up in the sky or here in your hands. And one day, it'll fall from the sky and hit you in the head real hard and that time, you won't have to put it back in the sky again.”

author: James M. Cain

author: Jeanette Winterson,

author: Antonin Artaud,

Et nous pourrions tout de même voir que c'est notre vénération devant ce qui a été déjà fait, si beau et si valable que ce soit, qui nous pétrifie, qui nous stabilise et nous empêche de prendre contact avec la force qui est dessous, que l'on appelle l'énergie pensante, la force vitale, le déterminisme des échanges, les menstrues de la lune ou tout ce qu'on voudra.”

author: Brandon Sanderson
quote_text: “It seems a simple task. We all know what water looks like, feels like in our mouth. Water is ubiquitous. Describing a cup of water feels a little like doing a still life painting. As a child I used to wonder: Why do people spend so much time painting bowls of fruit, when they could be painting dragons? Why learn to describe a cup of water, when the story is about cool magic and (well) dragons?

author: Autran Dourado,
quote_text: “(...) não vamos mais na ordenação desta história e no risco, Senhor, porque seria longo de ouvir. E o homem que ordena histórias não deve contar mais curto do que foi ou mais longo do que deve. Tal aprendi com os que ensinam a por em crônica sucessos de natureza vária.”

author: Sontia Levy,
quote_text: “Getting a spark of inspiration to write is the best feeling in the world, no matter what time it is...I get a feeling on the inside that urges me to get up from whatever I am doing, grabbing that pen and writing down whatever my heart and mind tell me too... it's beautiful." ”

author: Haruki Murakami,
quote_text: “Các hình ảnh, khung cảnh, ngôn từ...tất cả chúng đều vô cùng sống động trong tâm trí em. Viết đi! Chúng hét lên với em thế. Một câu chuyện mới mẻ tuyệt hay đang hình thành, em có thể cảm thấy nó. Nó mang em đến một nơi nào đó hoàn toàn mới. Nhưng rắc rối là một khi em ngồi vào bàn và trút tất cả ra giấy thì em lại thấy không diễn tả được cái chính yếu. Chúng không kết tinh lại được, chỉ là đá cuội chứ không phải pha lê. Và em chẳng đi đến đâu cả.”

author: Mark Helprin
quote_text: “I think of myself as more of a 12th-Century artist than a modern one—I write, not for my own pleasure or the pleasure of my audience, but to praise God.”

author: Emily Henry,
quote_text: “Like a gut-punch of a sentence, like a line so sharp you have to set the book aside to catch your breath.”

author: Deyth Banger
quote_text: “Stephen King have a lot of books about the writing not only "The Writting: Memoir and Craft", but and "Nightmares and Dreamscapes", however "Misery", also and "Bag of Bones" and even and others. Which is awesome, different perspectives for being a an writer.”

author: Deyth Banger
quote_text: “I live with past called "DeYtH" ( a guy who is famous with cs 1.6 maps, mods, photoshop and e.t.c. and with my now "Mark Tven", you probably said "Oh,Oh I know this name this guy was a writer..." it's not taken the guy was called Mark Twain, I'm Tven, famous with awesome maps and interesting updates of cs 1.6 maps. To don't forget, I'm famous with my nick of past with writting.”

author: Deyth Banger
quote_text: “Be glad that I'm not a horror writer, some people write about it, other make images... but third just create it??? As for me, I have create it from horror up to nightmares!”

author: Kaleb Kilton
quote_text: “Writing is like running a marathon. One needs stamina and perseverance. The right preparation and pacing get results.”

author: Anastasia Bolinder
quote_text: “Let us runaway to the aspirations we dream of in our childish moments, where magic is real and we are unstoppable.”

author: Nicolás Gómez Dávila
quote_text: “Phrases are pebbles that the writer tosses into the reader’s soul.

author: Bandy Sholtes,
quote_text: “Может, я излишне драматизирую? Но если не драматизировать, то и писать незачем. Книги - это и есть излишняя драматизация. Драматизация мыслей, историй, идей и прочего говна (зачеркнуто) шоколада. Писатели роются в шоколадном цеху и приукрашают каждую находку.

author: Deyth Banger,
quote_text: “I take writting as something in which you should in limited or not in limited time to create characters which the readers will like... feel compassion.”

author: Deyth Banger
quote_text: “Each book which so far is written is filled with a new thoughts... new images... new arguments... new discussions.”

author: Samuel Zamarripa
quote_text: “Writing is a place and getting there is the real art,” Otto Cristóbal Almeida.”

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote_text: “Si quieres ser un buen escritor, debes ser mil veces un buen lector.”

author: Luna Brandon,
quote_text: “Ela merece mais, muito mais. E se um dia eu viesse a ter algo com ela, jamais seria pedindo que ela se sujeitasse a ser minha amante.”

author: Elizabeth Gilbert,
quote_text: “Everything I’ve ever written has brought me into being. Every project has matured me in a different way. I am who I am today precisely because of what I have made, and what it has made me into. Creativity has hand raised me and forged me into an adult.”

author: Deyth Banger,
quote_text: “I am tired of writting... it has nothing to do with life.”

author: Ratish Edwards
quote_text: “Dard baantne se Kam hota hai, jitna baanto utna kum. Par hamesha aisa nahi hota, kabhi kabhi dard ho hota hai par zubaan se bahar nahi aa pata, kyunki hamara dard hume sambhalta hai, sikhata hai. Iss tarah k dard ko likh dena chahiye, ye vo dard hai vo sirf likh k kum hota hai.”

author: Cat Winters,
quote_text: “He can give everyone what they so desperately crave: hope for a life beyond death... Love poems fall out of fashion over time, often turning maudlin in the ears of future listeners. Humans' enjoyment of satire and humor is equally fickle, and epic adventures stop seeming so epic when new heroes accomplish new feats. Yet mortals' fear and bewilderment of death will never die - not as long as people keep dying.”

author: Santosh    Kumar
quote_text: “Philosophy tends to kindness for those who intend to write it.”

author: Alicia Peljhan
quote_text: “Ljubezen do pisanja – ljubezen, ki je že skorajda na meji norosti. Ohhh, ta opojni čutni občutek brezčasnosti, breztežnosti in popolne ekstaze. Neomejen občutek popolne predanosti in nevzdržni vrtinci čustev, ki te premetavajo kot orkan, da obnemogel obsediš predan zgodbi. A kljub temu, se vdano vračaš vsak dan k pisanju, kot da je to tvoj zrak, ki ga dihaš. Impulz, ki poganja tvoje srce.”

author: Florin-Marian Hera,
quote_text: “If I sought to be immortal, I would have written my eulogy on the hands of the wicked.”

author: Frank Herbert,
quote_text: “I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Attitude is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Optimism is a choice. Kindness is a choice. Giving is a choice. Respect is a choice. Whatever choice you make makes you. Choose wisely.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Live the Life of Your Dreams: Be brave enough to live the life of your dreams according to your vision and purpose instead of the expectations and opinions of others.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
quote_text: “It’s only after you’ve stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “Dare to Be

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals.

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.”

author: Viktor E. Frankl,
quote_text: “Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,

author: Steve Maraboli
quote_text: “Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,

quote_text: “Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.”

author: Steve Maraboli
quote_text: “Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
quote_text: “You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.”

author: Confucius,
quote_text: “The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote_text: “The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “Sometimes life knocks you on your ass... get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”

author: Garrison Keillor
quote_text: “Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car.”

author: C.S. Lewis
quote_text: “I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.”

author: C.S. Lewis
quote_text: “The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us.”

author: Charles Bukowski
quote_text: “For those who believe in God, most of the big questions are answered. But for those of us who can't readily accept the God formula, the big answers don't remain stone-written. We adjust to new conditions and discoveries. We are pliable. Love need not be a command nor faith a dictum. I am my own god. We are here to unlearn the teachings of the church, state, and our educational system. We are here to drink beer. We are here to kill war. We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that Death will tremble to take us.”

author: John Milton,
quote_text: “The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven..”

author: Stephen King,
quote_text: “When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off.”

author: George Carlin
quote_text: “Religion has actually convinced people that there's an invisible man living in the sky who watches everything you do, every minute of every day. And the invisible man has a special list of ten things he does not want you to do. And if you do any of these ten things, he has a special place, full of fire and smoke and burning and torture and anguish, where he will send you to live and suffer and burn and choke and scream and cry forever and ever 'til the end of time!

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote_text: “Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul. It is daily admission of one's weakness. It is better in prayer to have a heart without words than words without a heart.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote_text: “God has no religion.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_text: “In heaven, all the interesting people are missing.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote_text: “Hate the sin, love the sinner.”

author: C.S. Lewis,
quote_text: “A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_text: “I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.”

author: Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
quote_text: “Knock, And He'll open the door

author: William Blake,
quote_text: “A truth that's told with bad intent

author: Dan Brown,
quote_text: “Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.”

author: Douglas Adams,
quote_text: “Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?”

author: Christopher Hitchens,
quote_text: “Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that

author: C.S. Lewis
quote_text: “Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...”

author: Robert Frost
quote_text: “Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote_text: “My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.”

author: Harper Lee,
quote_text: “Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.”

author: Voltaire
quote_text: “Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.”

author: Charlotte Brontë,
quote_text: “No sight so sad as that of a naughty child," he began, "especially a naughty little girl. Do you know where the wicked go after death?"

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote_text: “All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_text: “Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man?”

author: John Lennon
quote_text: “I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.”

author: John Keats,
quote_text: “Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter”

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote_text: “When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.”

author: Dalai Lama XIV
quote_text: “My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.”

author: Kiera Cass,
quote_text: “True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.”

author: Johnny Depp
quote_text: “if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.”

author: Lady Gaga
quote_text: “I had a boyfriend who told me I’d never succeed, never be nominated for a Grammy, never have a hit song, and that he hoped I’d fail. I said to him, ‘Someday, when we’re not together, you won’t be able to order a cup of coffee at the fucking deli without hearing or seeing me.”

author: Rick Riordan,
quote_text: “It's okay,” he said. “We're together.” He didn't say

author: John Joseph Powell,
quote_text: “It is an absolute human certainty that no one can know his own beauty or perceive a sense of his own worth until it has been reflected back to him in the mirror of another loving, caring human being.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “When in a relationship, a real man doesn't make his woman jealous of others, he makes others jealous of his woman.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.”

author: Kiera Cass,
quote_text: “You’ve changed me forever. And I’ll never forget you.”

author: Vladimir Nabokov,
quote_text: “Oh, don't cry, I'm so sorry I cheated so much, but that's the way things are.”

author: Albert Camus
quote_text: “When you have once seen the glow of happiness on the face of a beloved person, you know that a man can have no vocation but to awaken that light on the faces surrounding him. In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.”

author: Sara Evans
quote_text: “Even on my weakest days

author: George Eliot,
quote_text: “What greater thing is there for two human souls, than to feel that they are joined for life--to strengthen each other in all labor, to rest on each other in all sorrow, to minister to each other in all pain, to be one with each other in silent unspeakable memories at the moment of the last parting?”

author: Nikita Gill
quote_text: “You fell in love with a storm. Did you really think you would get out unscathed?”

author: Kate Chisman,
quote_text: “We ruined each other by being together. We destroyed each other’s dreams.”

author: Bell Hooks,
quote_text: “All too often women believe it is a sign of commitment, an expression of love, to endure unkindness or cruelty, to forgive and forget. In actuality, when we love rightly we know that the healthy, loving response to cruelty and abuse is putting ourselves out of harm's way.”

author: Charlotte Brontë,
quote_text: “Jane, my little darling (so I will call you, for so you are), you don't know what you are talking about; you misjudge me again: it is not because she is mad I hate her. If you were mad, do you think I should hate you?"

author: Deb Caletti,
quote_text: “I used to think that finding the right one was about the man having a list of certain qualities. If he has them, we'd be compatible and happy. Sort of a checkmark system that was a complete failure. But I found out that a healthy relationship isn't so much about sense of humor or intelligence or attractive. It's about avoiding partners with harmful traits and personality types. And then it's about being with a good person. A good person on his own, and a good person with you. Where the space between you feels uncomplicated and happy. A good relationship is where things just work. They work because, whatever the list of qualities, whatever the reason, you happen to be really, really good together.”

author: Kathryn Stockett,
quote_text: “Stuart needs "space" and "time," as if this were physics and not a human relationship.”

author: Gillian Flynn,
quote_text: “I don't understand the point of being together if you're not the happiest.”

author: Charles Swindoll
quote_text: “Anything under God's control is never out of control.”

author: Greg Behrendt, Liz Tuccillo,
quote_text: “When it comes to men, deal with them as they are, not how you’d like them to be.”

author: Criss Jami,
quote_text: “If love is blind, then maybe a blind person that loves has a greater understanding of it.”

author: Nikita Gill
quote_text: “You are damaged and broken and unhinged. But so are shooting stars and comets.”

author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,
quote_text: “Don't blow off another's candle for it won't make yours shine brighter.”

author: Monique Duval
quote_text: “He offered her the world. She said she had her own.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
quote_text: “Be with someone who inspires you and makes you be the best version of yourself.”

author: Deb Caletti,
quote_text: “This is what I know. Don't settle for 40, 50, or even 80 percent. A relationship-it shouldn't be too small or too tight or even a little scratchy. It shouldn't take up space in your closet out of guilty conscience or convenience or a moment of desire. Do you hear me? It shold be perfect for you. It should be lasting. Wait. wait for 100 percent.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “If you're not comfortable enough with yourself or with your own truth when entering a relationship, then you're not ready for that relationship.”

author: Ally Carter,
quote_text: “...maybe it's only fitting that relationship that started with a lie would end with one.”

author: Winston S. Churchill
quote_text: “Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.”

author: Bessie Anderson Stanley,
quote_text: “He has achieved success who has lived well, laughed often, and loved much;

author: Herbert Bayard Swope
quote_text: “I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.”

author: W.C. Fields
quote_text: “If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.”

author: Herman Melville
quote_text: “It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.”

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “Dare to Be

author: Dr. Seuss,
quote_text: “So be sure when you step, Step with care and great tact. And remember that life's A Great Balancing Act. And will you succeed? Yes! You will, indeed! (98 and ¾ percent guaranteed) Kid, you'll move mountains.”

author: Steve Maraboli
quote_text: “Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.”

author: W.P. Kinsella
quote_text: “Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get”

author: Truman Capote
quote_text: “Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.”

author: Milan Kundera,
quote_text: “Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.”

author: Salvador Dali
quote_text: “Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.”

author: Winston S. Churchill
quote_text: “Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.”

author: Bette Midler
quote_text: “The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.”

author: Coco Chanel
quote_text: “Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. ”

author: Steve Maraboli
quote_text: “Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut”

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote_text: “I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.”

author: Walt Disney
quote_text: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. ”

author: Viktor E. Frankl,
quote_text: “Don't aim at success. The more you aim at it and make it a target, the more you are going to miss it. For success, like happiness, cannot be pursued; it must ensue, and it only does so as the unintended side effect of one's personal dedication to a cause greater than oneself or as the by-product of one's surrender to a person other than oneself. Happiness must happen, and the same holds for success: you have to let it happen by not caring about it. I want you to listen to what your conscience commands you to do and go on to carry it out to the best of your knowledge. Then you will live to see that in the long-run—in the long-run, I say!—success will follow you precisely because you had forgotten to think about it”

author: Hayley Williams
quote_text: “Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand”

author: Mark Twain
quote_text: “All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure. ”

author: Oliver Goldsmith,
quote_text: “Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.”

author: Pablo
quote_text: “No matter how old you are now. You are never too young or too old for success or going after what you want. Here’s a short list of people who accomplished great things at different ages

author: Theodore Roosevelt

author: Steve Maraboli,
quote_text: “Sometimes life knocks you on your ass... get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_text: “A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all.”

author: Marthe Troly-Curtin,

author: J.R.R. Tolkien,
quote_text: “I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo.

author: Sarah Dessen,
quote_text: “There comes a time when the world gets quiet and the only thing left is your own heart. So you'd better learn the sound of it. Otherwise you'll never understand what it's saying.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
quote_text: “Don’t waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.”

author: Anthony G. Oettinger
quote_text: “Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana.”

author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy
quote_text: “It has been said, 'time heals all wounds.' I do not agree. The wounds remain. In time, the mind, protecting its sanity, covers them with scar tissue and the pain lessens. But it is never gone.”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,
quote_text: “It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.”

author: Dave Eggers
quote_text: “Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Top 15 Things Money Can’t Buy

author: Dr. Seuss
quote_text: “How did it get so late so soon?”

author: Paulo Coelho
quote_text: “Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.”

author: Mother Theresa
quote_text: “Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.”

author: Eric Roth,
quote_text: “For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.”

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote_text: “You can have it all. Just not all at once.”

author: Coco Chanel
quote_text: “Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. ”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.”

author: Tennessee Williams,
quote_text: “Time is the longest distance between two places.”

author: Cassandra Clare,
quote_text: “They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite”

author: Andy Warhol,
quote_text: “They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.”

author: Dr. Seuss
quote_text: “They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!”

author: Charles Darwin,
quote_text: “A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote_text: “I sit beside the fire and think

author: Cormac McCarthy,

author: Taylor Swift
quote_text: “This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.”

author: Haruki Murakami,
quote_text: “Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut
quote_text: “Here we are, trapped in the amber of the moment. There is no why.”

author: Lao Tzu
quote_text: “Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.”

author: Audrey Niffenegger,
quote_text: “It's hard being left behind. (...) It's hard to be the one who stays.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “Time is an illusion.”

author: George Harrison
quote_text: “It's being here now that's important. There's no past and there's no future. Time is a very misleading thing. All there is ever, is the now. We can gain experience from the past, but we can't relive it; and we can hope for the future, but we don't know if there is one.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.”

author: Isaac Asimov
quote_text: “The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.”

author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson
quote_text: “The Seven Social Sins are:

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “Never memorize something that you can look up.”

author: Stephen Hawking
quote_text: “One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Two, never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it. Three, if you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?”

author: Carl Sagan
quote_text: “Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existence. One cannot help but be in awe when he contemplates the mysteries of eternity, of life, of the marvelous structure of reality. It is enough if one tries merely to comprehend a little of this mystery each day.

author: Douglas Adams,
quote_text: “The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be.”

author: Albert Einstein,
quote_text: “The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion that stands at the cradle of true art and true science.”

author: Terry Pratchett,
quote_text: “Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.”

author: Niels Bohr
quote_text: “An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.”

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote_text: “I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.”

author: Stephen Hawking
quote_text: “We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.”

author: Dan Brown,
quote_text: “Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.”

author: Terry Pratchett,
quote_text: “In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.”

author: Sarah   Williams,
quote_text: “Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light;

author: Christopher Hitchens
quote_text: “That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.”

author: Albert Einstein
quote_text: “Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.”

author: Charles Darwin,
quote_text: “A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.”

author: Marie Curie
quote_text: “Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.”

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote_text: “The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.”

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote_text: “For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.”

author: John Keats,
quote_text: “Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter”

author: Carl Sagan,
quote_text: “Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.”

author: Alan Alda
quote_text: “Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.”

author: Douglas Adams,
quote_text: “Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to space.”

author: Isaac Newton,
quote_text: “If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants.”

author: Carl Sagan,
quote_text: “If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_text: “A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.”

author: Nicolas Chamfort
quote_text: “The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.”

author: Herman Hesse,
quote_text: “For me, trees have always been the most penetrating preachers. I revere them when they live in tribes and families, in forests and groves. And even more I revere them when they stand alone. They are like lonely persons. Not like hermits who have stolen away out of some weakness, but like great, solitary men, like Beethoven and Nietzsche. In their highest boughs the world rustles, their roots rest in infinity; but they do not lose themselves there, they struggle with all the force of their lives for one thing only: to fulfil themselves according to their own laws, to build up their own form, to represent themselves. Nothing is holier, nothing is more exemplary than a beautiful, strong tree. When a tree is cut down and reveals its naked death-wound to the sun, one can read its whole history in the luminous, inscribed disk of its trunk: in the rings of its years, its scars, all the struggle, all the suffering, all the sickness, all the happiness and prosperity stand truly written, the narrow years and the luxurious years, the attacks withstood, the storms endured. And every young farmboy knows that the hardest and noblest wood has the narrowest rings, that high on the mountains and in continuing danger the most indestructible, the strongest, the ideal trees grow.

author: Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
quote_text: “Knock, And He'll open the door

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote_text: “Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.”

author: Don Miguel Ruiz
quote_text: “1. Be Impeccable With Your Word

author: John Lennon
quote_text: “I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.”

author: Carl Sagan,
quote_text: “Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.”

author: Roy T. Bennett,
quote_text: “Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.”

author: Anais Nin
quote_text: “The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.”

author: Anne Lamott
quote_text: “You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do.”

author: T D Jakes
quote_text: “No woman wants to be in submission to a man who isn't in submission to God!”

author: Mother Teresa,
quote_text: “The greatest disease in the West today is not TB or leprosy; it is being unwanted, unloved, and uncared for. We can cure physical diseases with medicine, but the only cure for loneliness, despair, and hopelessness is love. There are many in the world who are dying for a piece of bread but there are many more dying for a little love. The poverty in the West is a different kind of poverty -- it is not only a poverty of loneliness but also of spirituality. There's a hunger for love, as there is a hunger for God.”

author: Brian Weiss,
quote_text: “Forgive the past. It is over. Learn from it and let go. People are constantly changing and growing. Do not cling to a limited, disconnected, negative image of a person in the past. See that person now. Your relationship is always alive and changing.”

author: Saul Williams,
quote_text: “Have you ever lost yourself in a kiss? I mean pure psychedelic inebriation. Not just lustful petting but transcendental metamorphosis when you became aware that the greatness of this being was breathing into you. Licking the sides and corners of your mouth, like sealing a thousand fleshy envelopes filled with the essence of your passionate being and then opened by the same mouth and delivered back to you, over and over again - the first kiss of the rest of your life. A kiss that confirms that the universe is aligned, that the world's greatest resource is love, and maybe even that God is a woman. With or without a belief in God, all kisses are metaphors decipherable by allocations of time, circumstance, and understanding”

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote_text: “Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace.

author: Author-Poet Aberjhani,
quote_text: “Dare to love yourself

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
quote_text: “We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.”

author: Amit Ray,
quote_text: “It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,”

author: Paul Klee
quote_text: “A single day is enough to make us a little larger or, another time, a little smaller.”

author: Neil DeGrasse Tyson
quote_text: “We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.”

author: Hans Urs von Balthasar,
quote_text: “What you are is God's gift to you, what you become is your gift to God.”

author: June Ahern
quote_text: “How hurtful it can be to deny one's true self and live a life of lies just to appease others.”

author: Carl Sagan,
quote_text: “Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality. When we recognize our place in an immensity of light‐years and in the passage of ages, when we grasp the intricacy, beauty, and subtlety of life, then that soaring feeling, that sense of elation and humility combined, is surely spiritual. So are our emotions in the presence of great art or music or literature, or acts of exemplary selfless courage such as those of Mohandas Gandhi or Martin Luther King, Jr. The notion that science and spirituality are somehow mutually exclusive does a disservice to both.”

author: Fulton J. Sheen,
quote_text: “It takes three to make love, not two: you, your spouse, and God. Without God people only succeed in bringing out the worst in one another. Lovers who have nothing else to do but love each other soon find there is nothing else. Without a central loyalty life is unfinished.”

author: Stephen Richards,
quote_text: “The only time you fail is when you fall down and stay down.”

author: Osho
quote_text: “One thing: you have to walk, and create the way by your walking; you will not find a ready-made path. It is not so cheap, to reach to the ultimate realization of truth. You will have to create the path by walking yourself; the path is not ready-made, lying there and waiting for you. It is just like the sky: the birds fly, but they don't leave any footprints. You cannot follow them; there are no footprints left behind.”

author: Eckhart Tolle,
quote_text: “I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.”

author: Steve Maraboli
quote_text: “One of the most spiritual things you can do is embrace your humanity. Connect with those around you today. Say, "I love you", "I'm sorry", "I appreciate you", "I'm proud of you"...whatever you're feeling. Send random texts, write a cute note, embrace your truth and share it...cause a smile today for someone else...and give plenty of hugs.”

author: Anne Frank,
quote_text: “A quiet conscience makes one strong!”
